content: Five shots fired into a house and carTwo men were inside at the timeDo you know more? Email tips@dailymail.com Two young men have woken to the sound of gunshots being fired into their western Sydney home.

Emergency services were called to a home in Mena Way, Bidwill shortly after 2am Monday.Police were told three shots were fired into the home and another two were launched at a car parked in the driveway.

Three men wearing black hoodies were seen in the vicinity at the time while a black Holden Commodore was seen driving away shortly after shots were fired.Two men aged 22 and 30 inside the home were uninjured.Mount Druitt Police have set up a crime scene and launched an investigation.Multiple police vehicles remained at the scene on Monday morning.Police are investigating whether the shooting is linked to car found on fire in nearby Penrith a few hours later.The car will be forensically examined.Anyone with information is urged to call Crime Stoppers.
